page.title: 09The Town Clerk of Brackley
page.content: We interviewed Mr. Wheatcroft who is Brackley's Town Clerk. A Town Clerk has to run the administration of the town. Mr. Wheatcroft is responsible for the Town Hall, open spaces and greens, the lake, cemetaries, the Park, fairs and the Market Place. He is also concerned about keeping Brackley clean. He said that he felt a sense of achievement as it had finally been decided that Brackley should have a bypass; he has wanted this to happen for a long time. His official robes are a horse hair wig, doctor's "tabs", a black robe and white gloves. His wig has to be sent away sometimes to be cleaned. This costs between ten and fifteen pounds. Although he did not grow up in Brackley, Mr. Wheatcroft likes the town very much. He wanted to be Town Clerk because he could change things and have responsibility.
